item.title: a learning notes of gtsummary
item.description: # install.packages("gtsummary") library(gtsummary) library(tidyverse) Basic Usage You can also embed plots, for example: head(trial) ## # A tibble: 6 x 8 ## trt age marker stage grade response death ttdeath ## <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <fct> <fct> <int> <int> <dbl> ## 1 Drug A 23 0.16 T1 II 0 0 24 ## 2 Drug B 9 1.11 T2 I 1 0 24 ## 3 Drug A 31 0.277 T1 II 0 0 24 ## 4 Drug A NA 2.

item.title: TidyTuesday学习笔记--Nobel_Laureate
item.description: 原视频地址：https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1P4411m75N?from=search&seid=7741503924513681460&spm_id_from=333.337.0.0 Load needed packages library(tidyverse) library(lubridate) Get the data! nobel_winners <- readr::read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2019/2019-05-14/nobel_winners.csv") %>% distinct(full_name, prize_year, category, .keep_all = T) %>% mutate(decade = 10*(prize_year%/%10), age = prize_year - year(birth_date)) nobel_winner_all_pubs <- readr::read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2019/2019-05-14/nobel_winner_all_pubs.csv") %>% mutate(prize_decade = 10*(prize_year %/% 10)) Winners per decade by category nobel_winners %>% group_by(category,decade) %>% summarise(winners = n(), winners_per_year = winners / n_distinct(prize_year)) %>% ggplot(aes(decade, winners_per_year, color= category)) + geom_line() + expand_limits(y=0) ## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'category'.
